items.title: Drugmakers face skincare price-fixing lawsuit, judge rules
items.summary:
- A federal judge in Connecticut ruled that 36 drugmakers, including Pfizer, Perrigo and Sandoz, must face claims alleging they conspired to fix prices for 80 generic drugs, many for *skin ailments*. 
- Led by Connecticut, the states’ suit accuses the companies of *price-fixing*, *conspiracy*, and allocating customers for 80 generic drugs between 2009 and 2016, many used for skin conditions. 
- In a 130-page decision, Chief Judge Michael Shea rejected claims of undue delays and found evidence of *concealment*, indicating acts to hide the alleged wrongdoing.

items.title: Nexperia China unit says it has inventories after suspension
items.summary:
- **Nexperia China** says it has *sufficient inventories* of finished goods and WIP, keeping the supply chain secure after the Dutch parent halted wafer supplies.
- It is accelerating qualification of new wafer sources to meet customer demand next year and has contingency plans in place.
- Beijing previously blocked shipments; the dispute could affect automakers and trade, with export exemptions under review.

items.title: Russian manufacturing sector contracts further in October
items.summary:
- The PMI fell to *48.0* in October, marking the steepest contraction since *July* and signaling ongoing weakness in Russia's manufacturing. 
- Output and new orders declined as firms cut *employment* and *input buying*, while *export orders* returned to growth in existing markets. 
- Cost pressures eased with *input costs* rising at the joint-slowest pace since February 2009, aided by lower *metal prices* and firms cutting *output charges*, with delivery times improving.

items.title: Taiwan APEC rep discusses chips with US Treasury's Bessent
items.summary:
- *Taiwan*'s APEC rep Lin Hsin-i and *US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent* discussed supply chains and semiconductors on the APEC sidelines in South Korea, stressing the chip industry's importance. 
- Lin said the meeting was a 'very wide-ranging' discussion on tech cooperation and supply-chain security, with Bessent *keen to hear how Taiwan built its high-tech semiconductor cluster*. 
- The piece notes a 20% tariff on Taiwan exports to the US (excluding semiconductors) and Taiwan's APEC status as 'Chinese Taipei', as China plans to host the 2026 APEC in Shenzhen.

items.title: Steel makers seek more govt measures to curb rising imports
items.summary:
- Steel makers are urging the government to curb rising imports through stronger measures to protect domestic steel output, with emphasis on *curb rising imports*. 
- They point to China's high crude steel production and rising imports, noting domestic utilisation of stainless steel around *60%* due to cheap imports. 
- They advocate extending *Quality Control Orders (QCOs)* and other safeguards under the *Atmanirbhar* initiative to support future capacity growth.

items.title: PM Modi launches ₹1 lakh crore R&D scheme
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- PM Modi will launch the ₹1 lakh crore *RDI Scheme Fund* to strengthen India's private-sector *R&D ecosystem* at ESTIC 2025 in New Delhi. 
- The plan aims to boost private investment in R&D and deepen industry–academia collaboration across 11 thematic areas, including *AI*, *Advanced Materials & Manufacturing*, *Energy*, and *Health & Medical Technologies*. 
- ESTIC 2025 (Nov 3–5) will bring 3,000+ participants from academia, research, industry and government for talks, panels and technology showcases.

items.title: SiCSem breaks ground on India’s first SiC plant in Odisha
items.summary:
- **SiCSem** breaks ground in *Odisha* for India's first end-to-end *silicon carbide semiconductor* plant, with about **Rs 2,000 crore** investment and capacity of **60,000 wafers/year**, slated to operate by *2027-28*. 
- The project includes partnership with **IIT Bhubaneswar** for a *semiconductor research lab*, and **Rs 4.95 crore** MPLAD for the NaMo Semiconductor Lab, announced by **Ashwini Vaishnaw**. 
- **SiCSem** is a *subsidiary of Archean Chemical Industries*; cabinet approval came on Aug 12, signaling growth of India's electronics sector and exports.

Adani Solar becomes first Indian firm to ship over 15,000 MW of solar modules
JK Cement Q2 profit up 17% to ₹159 cr
items.summary:
- JK Cement reported *Q2 FY26 PAT* of ₹159 crore, up 17% *YoY* from ₹136 crore.
- Consolidated revenue from operations rose 18% *YoY* to ₹3,019 crore, supported by higher volumes, while total expenses climbed to ₹2,827 crore due to power, fuel and freight costs.
- The company completed the amalgamation of Toshali Cements and expanded Prayagraj grinding unit capacity from 2 to 3 MTPA via internal debottlenecking.

Air India completes retrofit of 27 legacy A320 neo aircraft
items.author: PTI
items.summary: - Air India has completed retrofitting 27 legacy A320neo aircraft, now with **premium economy** seats.\n- The retrofit, part of a **USD 400 million** fleet modernization begun in September 2024, upgrades the legacy fleet.\n- The program adds **4,428** new seats and supports **3,024 weekly flights** across 82 routes.

Hindustan Unilever gets ₹1,986 crore tax notice
items.summary:
- Hindustan Unilever's India arm received a tax demand order of **₹1,986.25 crore** for FY 2020-21 from the tax authority.
- The tax department reportedly disputed **related-party transactions** and questioned some **depreciation claims**, without providing further details.
- The company said the order will have no material impact and will **appeal** against the demand.

items.title: Post-Sindoor wargame: 25 ships, 40+ jets, 40k troops
items.author: Manu Pubby, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The article covers India's *Ex Trishul* tri-service wargame (*Operation Sindoor*) with 25 warships, 40+ jets and 40,000+ soldiers across *Gujarat*, *Rajasthan* and the *Arabian Sea*.
- It highlights multi-domain planning, including *space- and cyber-based* elements, amphibious ships like *INS Jalashwa*, and focus on *Rann of Kutch* and *Sir Creek* amid airspace notices and NOTAMs.
- The exercise, observed by *Pakistan* and running until *November 13, 2025*, shows cross-service coordination among the Navy, Air Force and Army with regional security implications.

items.title: AM/NS India secures green nod, land for ₹80,000 crore steel plant in Andhra Pradesh
Govt extends stainless steel import curbs relief to Dec 31
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The government extended the relaxation on *BIS non-compliant stainless steel* imports till *December 31* to address *inadequate domestic production*. 
- Domestic manufacturers warned exemptions erode market share and slow *capital-recovery* amid ongoing imports. 
- *ISSDA* backed the extension, urging imports only when domestic production is unavailable to curb *Chinese dumping* and *substandard steel*.

items.title: MediaTek targets billions in AI chip revenue by 2027
items.summary:
- MediaTek aims to generate **$1B** in cloud AI chip revenue in 2026 and **billions** more in 2027 from its AI accelerator ASICs, CEO Rick Tsai says.
- The data-center ASIC TAM is about **$50B** and MediaTek targets **10–15%** market share in two years, aided by Nvidia co-design of the GB10 Grace Blackwell Superchip.
- Competition from **Qualcomm** and Nvidia/Intel moves frame the landscape as MediaTek reports Q3 revenue of **T$142.1B**; stock is down about **7.4%** this year.

Titagarh Rail Systems secures Mumbai Metro Line 5 contract
items.summary:
- The contract from *MMRDA* covers design, manufacture, supply, installation, integration, testing and commissioning of rolling stock and signaling for Mumbai Metro Line 5, valued at ₹2,481 crore plus GST.
- The scope includes 132 metro coaches over 24.9 km across 16 stations with five years of maintenance, spanning Phase 1 and Phase 2.
- **Umesh Chowdhary**, *Make-in-India* and *driverless* trainsets highlight Titagarh's growing role in India’s metro infra.

items.title: India aims for 500 GW non-fossil target: TERI DG
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- India has reached 127 GW of installed solar capacity and is on track toward a **500 GW non-fossil energy target by 2030**, according to *Vibha Dhawan*, Director-General of TERI.
- Government actions like the **National Green Hydrogen Mission** and Production-Linked Incentive schemes for solar and battery manufacturing are strengthening the domestic value chain.
- Industry partnerships, including LONGi–INOX's 5 GW module supply plan and INOX Solar’s leadership, demonstrate policy support and the growth of solar‑storage.

Acerinox Q3 misses, warns of short-term uncertainty
items.summary: - Acerinox posted a weaker-than-expected Q3, with *adjusted EBITDA* of €108m vs €112m consensus and *net profit* of €25m, missing JPMorgan's view by about 31%.\n- The outlook remains uncertain with *demand at low levels* and the US expected to see a Q4 decline due to year-end seasonality.\n- Tariffs offer some benefit in the US, but ongoing *trade uncertainty* and European quotas may influence results, with Q4 EBITDA expected to stay below Q3.

items.title: Thyssenkrupp names Marie Jaroni as new steel boss
items.summary: - *Marie Jaroni* has been appointed as the new CEO of Thyssenkrupp's steel unit (TKSE), effective November 1, replacing Dennis Grimm.\n- She previously led the division's sales and transformation efforts after a series of roles, as Grimm's departure coincides with TKSE's restructuring and ongoing talks with *Jindal Steel International*.\n- The move comes as TKSE deepens talks with *Jindal Steel International* and pursues a potential sale, signaling strategic realignment for the group.

Vedanta Q2 net profit falls 38% to ₹3,479 crore
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary: - Vedanta's Q2 *PAT* fell 38% YoY to ₹3,479 crore, weighed down by *exceptional losses* and higher costs. - *Revenue* rose 6% YoY to ₹39,868 crore and *EBITDA* stood at ₹11,612 crore with a margin near 21%, though *PAT* declined sequentially. - The company booked an exceptional ₹2,067 crore loss tied to asset write-offs and settlement charges at **Talwandi Sabo Power Ltd**.

items.title: Kalpataru Projects Q2 net profit jumps 89% to ₹237 crore
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- KPIL's Q2 PAT rose to ₹237 crore, an **89% YoY** jump, on stronger execution and a healthy order backlog.
- Revenue up 32% to ₹6,529 crore; EBITDA ₹561 crore with an **8.6% margin**; H1 FY26 revenue ₹12,700 crore and PAT ₹451 crore.
- Net debt fell 14% to ₹3,169 crore; FY26 inflows ₹14,951 crore and order book at ₹64,682 crore; MD Manish Mohnot calls it the best-ever Q2 for revenue and profitability.

items.title: Mahindra completes liquidation of Australian aerospace unit
items.summary:
- The completion of the *voluntary liquidation* of **MAAPL** after deregistration dissolves **MAAPL** and marks the end of its role in *aircraft manufacturing* under the Mahindra group, with **MAPL** receiving proceeds.
- Earlier, **MAAPL** divested stakes in Gipps Aero, GA8 Airvan, GA200, Nomad TC, Airvan 10 and Airvan Flight Services, after which these entities ceased to be subsidiaries of **MAAPL**, **MAPL** and M&M.
- Upon liquidation, **MAPL** received about ₹17.12 crore as distribution toward its full shareholding in **MAAPL**; **MAAPL** contributed ₹0.48 crore in revenue for FY2025 and had a net worth of ₹16.43 crore.

items.title: India–France defence ties deepen as AXISCADES, Cilas team up on laser-based anti-drone system
items.summary:
- *AXISCADES* and *Cilas* sign an MoU to co-develop a vehicle-mounted C-UAS built around *Helma-P* laser for India’s armed forces. 
- The system will couple Helma-P with AXISCADES’ indigenous C2 platform to enhance self-reliant defence under *Atmanirbhar Bharat*. 
- The deal marks a step forward in India–France defence ties and joint innovation in locally integrated security tech.

items.title: BEL Q2 profit rises 18% to ₹1,286 crore
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - *PAT* of ₹1,286 crore, up 18% YoY, on revenue from operations of *₹5,764 crore*.\n- For H1 FY26, *revenue from operations* was ₹10,180 crore with *PBT* ₹3,024 crore and *PAT* ₹2,255 crore.\n- The *order book* as of Oct 1, 2025 stood at ₹74,453 crore, signaling a strong pipeline across defence and non-defence segments.

items.title: India, US sign 10-year defence cooperation framework
Loom Solar to set up 1.2 GW module facility in UP
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- Loom Solar announced a **1.2 GW** solar module facility in *Uttar Pradesh* to boost domestic manufacturing and technological innovation.
- The facility will prioritize advanced tech such as *Heterojunction solar cell technology* and support high-efficiency modules, inverters, and storage for large-scale projects under the **PM-KUSUM Scheme**.
- Amod Anand, Co-Founder and Director, called the project a roadmap toward *India's clean energy independence* and stronger BESS/inverter manufacturing.

items.title: Cochin Shipyard, Svitzer to build EV tugs in India
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- CSL and Svitzer signed a Letter of Intent to jointly develop electric TRAnsverse tugboats in India.
- The agreement, announced during India Maritime Week in Mumbai, aims to boost India's shipbuilding capabilities and clean maritime technology.
- The collaboration pairs CSL's manufacturing strength with Svitzer's towage expertise to deploy greener harbour operations aligned with Maritime India Vision 2030.

items.title: Samsung-Nvidia talks on HBM4 AI memory chips
items.summary:
- Samsung is in close discussion with **Nvidia** to supply its upcoming **HBM4** memory chips for AI workloads.
- Analysts say the **HBM4** rollout will be a litmus test for Samsung's ability to reclaim its edge in the AI-chip market.
- Nvidia confirmed a key supply collaboration for **HBM3E** and **HBM4** with Samsung, with commercialisation planned next year.

items.title: Hindustan Platinum to import used catalysts from ME & Europe
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Hindustan Platinum* is exploring imports of *spent catalysts* from oil refineries in the Middle East, Asia and Europe to secure long-term supplies of materials.
- The move aims to meet the growing *demand for precious metals* amid India's rapid industrial growth, with talks in Belgium, Germany, Italy and Poland during the *European Refining Technology Conference* in Cannes (Nov 17–20, 2025).
- The company plans to build a global supplier network to refine and extract *platinum*, *palladium*, *silver* and other metals, and may expand into the *renewable energy* sector.

items.title: L&T, US firm GA-ASI partner to manufacture advanced combat drones in India
Ford to revive Tamil Nadu engine plant with ₹32.5bn
items.summary:
- Ford to invest about **₹32.5 billion** to revive the Maraimalai Nagar plant near Chennai, boosting output to **over 200,000 engines/year** for export.
- The move signals renewed confidence in *India as a manufacturing hub* under CEO *Jim Farley*, even as Ford pivots from EVs amid trade tensions and tariffs.
- *Tamil Nadu*, a key auto hub, could gain stronger industrial ties as Ford joins Hyundai, Renault and BMW in expanding local production.

items.title: India to boost maritime sector for 2047 goal
items.summary:
- *Mansukh Mandaviya* urged focusing on the *maritime sector* to make India a developed nation by *2047*.
- He cited that about 95% of India's trade by volume and 70% by value moves by sea and called for an ecosystem to boost *shipbuilding*.
- He added that sea powers rule the world, noted *Vasco da Gama*'s role, and highlighted India Maritime Week 2025 to drive maritime growth.

items.title: DP World to invest $5 billion in India's infrastructure
items.summary:
- DP World pledged to invest an additional *$5 billion* in India to strengthen its *integrated supply chain network*, supporting exports and domestic trade. 
- The MoUs signed at India Maritime Week target *green coastal shipping*, *shipbuilding*, *ship repair*, *skill development*, and *advanced freight mobility* to boost sustainable growth. 
- Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem said the investment underscores India's role in global *maritime and logistics* and enhances its competitiveness in *global trade*.

items.title: Airbus cuts production rate target for its A220 jet
items.summary:
- Airbus cut its *A220* monthly production target to 12 jets in 2026 from 14, citing supply constraints and airlines awaiting upgraded engines.
- CEO *Guillaume Faury* said the 12-per-month target isn't the final rate and the timing to reach the higher rate remains unclear.
- Despite the pause on the A220, Airbus reaffirmed forecasts for higher rates on other models (e.g., 75 *A320neo* per month in 2027) and about 820 jet deliveries in 2025.

items.title: Green hydrogen is the industrial game-changer for India’s steel sector
Customer experience reimagined: The power of empathy, data and design
ASK Automotive Q2 net profit rises 19% to ₹80 crore
items.summary:
- Q2 FY26 revenue rose *8.5% YoY* to ₹1,059 crore, with PAT at *₹80 crore*, up *18.6%*, and EBITDA ₹142 crore with a margin of *13.4%*. 
- H1 FY26 revenue was ₹1,954 crore and PAT ₹146 crore; EBITDA ₹265 crore with margins of *13.6%*, reflecting sustained growth. 
- Segment highlights show *Advanced Braking Systems* up *10% Q2* (7% H1) and *Aluminium Light Weighting Precision Solutions* up *22% Q2* (19% H1), while *Wheel Assembly* fell about *53.6% in Q2* (53.5% H1); exports declined.
